result.execSummary:
The defendant Monica L. Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Monica L. Allen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Monica L. Allen was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Monica L. Allen was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:32 pm Defendant Monica L. Allen in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michlig/Richards/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Jail - 7 months - each count - CC
Jail credit - 101 days
Up to 45 days at end of sentence - may allow in-patient treatment at Koinonia - Will allow day for day credit if successfuly completes in-patient treatment.
Unpaid financial obligations reduced to civil judgment.
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 2:45 p.m. 
Off record - Court states -n May serve in Oneida or Vilas County.
Adj. 2:47 p.m.
- includes cover letter and revocation summary
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-26-2016 02:00 pm

Defendant Monica L. Allen in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:19
State moves to dismiss count 3  - Granted - Plea questionnaire filed- No contest plea to counts 1 and 2-   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Schiek/Richards/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing- 
Court WHS and POP for 1 year- each CC
CC/CV/Supervision fees/DNA sample/surcharge(250 from bond applied) Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO - 17 days credit if revoked 
Appeal rights given   The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

1:17 p.m. Defendant Monica L. Allen in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant as to late appearance - Defendant states her mother never showed up for ride and she had to find another ride and apologizes for late arrival.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. State files Information - Richards in receipt of Information and waives further reading. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Richards enters not guilty plea on behalf of Defendant. Bail continued. Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 11:00 am. Adj. 1:19 p.m.

8:34 a.m. Defendant Monica L. Allen in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Monica L. Allen in custody.  Attorney Richards appeared by telephone with leave of Court. Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Richards in receipt of complaint - waives further reading. Richards/Defendant statement to bond. Richards statement as to Vilas County cases. Bail continued. Adj. 8:38 a.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
May be released to inpatient treatment if unable to post bond -Must either be in inpatient treatment or in jail if bond is not posted

Defendant Monica L. Allen in court in custody - with Attorney John Voorhees-   Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:38
Schiek statement to status- Voorhees statement - Atty Richards was appointed to this case now (represents in Vilas Cases also) but was unable to appear today- and request reschedule- Voorhees appears today for purposes of bail - gives statement - Schiek statement - Court statement - already had lowered it to $250 - Court continues bond as set - but would allow release to inpatient treatment -  Status conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 11:30 am.

2:42 P.M. Defendant Monica L. Allen in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Monica L. Allen in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Defendant requests bond modification - Voorhees statement to bond - Voorhees states may have conflict within pd's office - case will probably re assigned - Schiek statement to bond. Court modifies to $250 cash bond
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 11:30 am.

1:22 pm. Defendant Monica L. Allen in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $  bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
